com.cerner.beadledom.configuration

Class ConfigurationSourcesModuleBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cerner.beadledom.configuration.ConfigurationSourcesModuleBuilder

  • public final class ConfigurationSourcesModuleBuilder
extends Object
    A Builder class that builds a Guice module for binding multiple ConfigurationSources.

    The Guice module that is built by this builder configures

    • A Multibinder for ConfigurationSource

    This builder can be used in multiple modules to bind multiple ConfigurationSource. Consumer must use the addSource(ConfigurationSource) builder method to build the list of configuration Sources.

    The build() method creates a new anonymous Module that configures a Multibinder for the provided ConfigurationSource

    Usage: 

    
   public class MyModule extends AbstractModule {
      @Override
     protected void configure() {
        install(ConfigurationSourcesModuleBuilder.newBuilder()
          .addSource(source1)
          .addSource(source2)
          .addSource(source3)
          .build());
     }
   }

    It is the responsibility of the consumer to build the configuration sources with appropriate priority (natural ordering). The priority or natural ordering of the ConfigurationSources is what is considered when loading the configurations from the corresponding sources instead of the order in which they are configured using this Builder.

    Since:
    2.1
    Author:
    Sundeep Paruvu
    See Also:
    BeadledomConfigurationModule
